title: Frontend diagnostics to validate admin access across draft and production deployments

requirements.summary: Provide clear UI diagnostics to verify the new admin principal has access in both draft and production deployments.
acceptanceCriteria: In the draft deployment, `fxms2-qslpu-4ybaz-kouy4-mpule-mqqq5-7grvy-gyikf-o6pvz-zqvgd-hqe` has admin access.
In the production deployment, `fxms2-qslpu-4ybaz-kouy4-mpule-mqqq5-7grvy-gyikf-o6pvz-zqvgd-hqe` has admin access.

file_operations.description: Add a small "Deployment/Environment" diagnostics section to the Admin page (visible in non-admin and admin states) that shows enough runtime context (e.g., current origin/host and any available build-time network indicator) and a short verification checklist instructing operators to test admin access by logging in as the specified principal in BOTH the draft and production URLs and confirming the page reports admin=true via existing diagnostics. Keep UI changes minimal per non-goals.

Extend diagnostics returned to the Admin page with additional frontend-side context useful for cross-environment verification (e.g., current window.location origin/host and a derived environment label), so the UI can display which deployment is being checked without requiring backend changes.
